Posted By: pedrodyl (8/2/2011 6:19:42 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: 2/5. This drake isn't ultimately bad. A (in combat) 3/4 flier for 4 in green is pretty handy. I'd rather use some other method of dealing with flying enemies...like [Hurricane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hurricane). Plus having this guy out makes it so you now have something that'll die to your anti-flying cards. Still better than some other drakes in this set...ironically better than the blue uncommon drake that seems to be a part of this 4 drop drake cycle.
posts.html:
2/5. This drake isn't ultimately bad. A (in combat) 3/4 flier for 4 in green is pretty handy. I'd rather use some other method of dealing with flying enemies...like Hurricane. Still better than some other drakes in this set...ironically better than the blue uncommon drake that seems to be a part of this 4 drop drake cycle.

Posted By: kitsunewarlock (6/2/2009 3:20:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Actually, I don't think it's all that bad. Green, especially in recent sets, has gotten plenty of flier-directed removal, which could mean that this drake would be pretty much unopposed on the attack. Of course, that doesn't solve the fact that it's still a horrible blocker, but hey, one can't have everything in life, eh?
